poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: We walk, that's what we do. We walk and think. Big head, slim hips, tough parturition. We inflict. Infliction is our thing. Stir-fry the biosphere. Some wonk says Man may not survive But life will. Cool. Fire off some bugs A megacolony of hardy beetles; lots of dung And beetle juice; a dictionary and wiki rocket science. By the time they reach the nearest plausible planet They'll have sussed which way is up.
